message.content:
The sum of the first 20 positive multiples of 5 is $5+10+15+\dots+100$. The sum of an arithmetic series is equal to the average of the first and last term, multiplied by the number of terms, so this sum is $(5+100)/2\cdot20=50\cdot20=1000$.

The sum of the first 20 positive even integers is $2+4+6+\dots+40$. Again, the sum of an arithmetic series is equal to the average of the first and last term, multiplied by the number of terms, so this sum is $(2+40)/2\cdot20=42\cdot10=420$.

The positive difference between these two sums is $1000-420=\boxed{580}$.
